tables.Time/Retired: Collision De La Rosa is listed as Did Not Start in the official results, despite having taken the first start prior to the race being stopped. Regulations at the time were such that in the event of a stoppage being ordered on the first lap, that start would be deemed null-and-void, and the second start would take place as if the first had never occurred. As this driver didn't make the second start, he is classified DNS. *

title: List of racing cyclists and pacemakers with a cycling-related death

tables.Name: Pierre  Froget
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed at the Velodrome in Vichy while tandem racing as a track cyclist. Died six days later at the age of 21, was the first death in a cycling crash on a French track. Das Stahlrad , 1894, p. 850, Frankfort Germany

tables.Name: Bert  Harris
tables.Location of death and additional informa: While participating in a race at Aston on Easter Monday of 1897 Harris' cycle touched another rider and he was upset head-first onto the track's surface. Harris died a few days later, never having regained consciousness. Tens of thousands of mourners lined the streets of Leicester for his funeral procession.

tables.Name: Muller
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Due to a fall during a competition on the winter track in Hamburg , Mullier died directly at the scene. Kocher, the cyclist of the pacemaker, decided to quit cycling.

tables.Name: Harry Miles William Stafford
tables.Location of death and additional informa: During a race at the Waltham, Massachusetts track, four tandem-motorcycles crash. Pacemakers Miles and Stafford, both 25 years old, are killed in the crash.

tables.Name: Oscar  Aaronson Some sources spell Oscar Aaronson's last name as "Aronson".
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Injured during December 16, 1900 competitors' crash at the New York City/ Madison Square Garden Six-Day Race. Died on the 22nd from aftereffects of the crash, from exhaustion and pneumonia.

tables.Name: Johnny  Nelson
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Nelson was a professional cyclist originally from Chicago. On September 4, 1901 he was in a 15-mile match race with Jimmy Michael at Madison Square Garden . Two miles into the race a tire on Nelson's pacemaker's vehicle exploded. Nelson then collided with the vehicles of both his pacemaker and Michael's pacemaker. Nelson's leg was badly lacerated in the crash and he suffered a massive blood loss. He died two days later in Bellevue Hospital .

tables.Name: Charles  Kerff
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Kerff crashed during the French cycling classic Marseille–Paris in which his brother Marcel also participated. The cause was unknown but Kerff had no visible injuries and was unconscious immediately after the crash. He was taken to the hospital in Aix-en-Provence but was dead on arrival.

tables.Name: Harry  Elkes
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man on his bicycle headed towards the camera |Harry Elkes on his bicycle
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash at Charles River Track in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Held the world record for "paced-cycle racing" during most of his career and just prior to his fatal crash had achieved a new 5 Miles World Record (going that distance in 6 minutes, 12 1/5 seconds) as well as achieving world's records for 10 and 15 miles. Major Taylor in his autobiography called Elkes "one of the greatest middle-distance riders that ever pedalled a bicycle."

tables.Name: Alfred  Görnemann
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A picture of a man beside a bike| Alfred Görnemann posing beside his bike
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Collided with his pacemaker during an October 11, 1903 race on the Dresden track and died that evening.

tables.Name: Jules  Oreggia
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died during a stayers race at the Marseille velodrome

tables.Name: Pilack
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died at the track while acting as a pacemaker during a race

tables.Name: Paul  Dangla
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man holding up a bike|Paul Dangla holding one of his bikes
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died from injuries he received in a crash on a track at Magdeburg, Germany.

tables.Name: Karl   Käser
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist standing next to his bike in a crowd|Käser in 1903
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Was killed during a paced race between himself and Thaddeus Robl at the Plauen track in Saxony, Germany. Was utilizing a 24-inch tire on a 22-inch wheel and in the moments before his fatal crash Käser had just pushed back his safety helmet. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 3, 1904, p. 104. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt. The reference Sport-Album der Rad-Welt" was an annual compendium of the sports-newspaper Rad-Welt or "Bike World" which included a column, "Die Toten der Rennbahn" (or "The Dead of the Racetrack") that consisted of obituaries for dead cyclists. Some sources spell Käser's name as "Carl Kaeser" see "Trove"/The Sydney Mail reference.

tables.Name: George  Leander
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist getting an assisted push from a pedestrian|George Leander being pushed on a bike by unidentified man.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died as a result of injuries during a race at the Parc des Princes track (or velodrome) in Paris. Had been going 92 kmh/57   mph at the time.

tables.Name: Jimmy  Michael
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Black & white studio portrait of a man|Studio portrait of Jimmy Michael sometime before 1904, exact date unknown
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died November 20, 1904 as a result of the injuries he received in a crash at a Berlin track a year or two before where his skull was fractured. It is thought that Michael probably had some kind of brain damage from the fall, as afterwards he suffered from severe headaches, had partial paralysis of his face, and had lapses of memory. Michael was en route from the UK to the United States on the ocean steamer "Savoie". The night before he died Michael complained of feeling sick and nauseous, telling the ship's doctor that his symptoms were the result of the Berlin track crash. Mangan, pp.130–131 Some sources state he died from alcoholic delirium tremens or a brain hemorrhage.

tables.Name: Charles Albert  Brécy
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Posed photos of a male cyclist on a bicycle in a studio |2 studio photos of Brecy with a racing bicycle
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed into his pacemaker's motorcycle when the engine failed, died eleven days later. The crash occurred during an attempt to break the Paced Hour Record (meaning how much distance could be achieved within an hour) at the Parc des Princes velodrome.

tables.Name: Hubert   Sevenich
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist on a bicycle in a crowd of pedestrians|Sevenich on his bicycle in a crowd
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Sevenich's sixth stayer competition as a professional was the Grand Prix of Brunswijk on 7 May 1905. During the race a pacer's motorcycle collided with others on the track and Sevenich was crushed to death against the track's guardrail. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 4, 1905, p. 72. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Willy  Schmitter
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist behind a pacemaking motorcycle during a race|Willy Schmitter on his bicycle behind his pacemaker Péguy
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Suffered a skull fracture in a crash during the European Championship at the Leipzig track and died a few hours afterwards

tables.Name: Gustav  Freudenberg
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist riding his bicycle on a track|Freudenberg in 1906
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Collided with a pacemaker's motorcycle at the track in Magdeburg . An artery in his right leg was torn open and he died at the track as a result of his injuries. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , vol. 5, 1906, p. 68. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Richard  Huhndorf
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist riding his bicycle|Huhndorf on his bicycle in 1905
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Fatally injured during a 100   km race, the Kleinen Golden Rad von Halle Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 5, 1906, p. 69. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Charles  Péguy
tables.Image: 100px|alt= A male cyclist behind a man on a pacemaking motorcycle|Péguy acting as pacemaker to Willy Schmitter in 1905
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash on the Spandau Track in Berlin. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 6/1907, p. 55. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Louis Mettling
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist headed directly toward the camera|Mettling on his racing cycle
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in his sleep on June 21 as a result of a crash during a 50-mile pace-following race on the Dresden track June 9, 1907 Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 6, 1907, p. 50. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Josef  Schwarzer
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Düsseldorf track Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 7, 1908, p. 45. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Moritz  Hübner
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man with a wreath around his neck|Hübner in 1906
tables.Location of death and additional informa: During "Die Goldpokal", a 100   km stayers' race, Hübner fell to the track when his pacing motorcycle broke down, then was fatally injured when a succeeding cycle ran over his body. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 6, 1907, p. 60. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Gustav  Schadebrodt
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man on a pacer-motocycle and a male cyclist|Gustav Schadebrodt on a bicycle
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash at the Brandenburg track with his brother Otto as pacemaker. The two Schadebrodt brothers were a team, Otto Schadebrodt the pacemaker riding a motorcycle in front and Gustav riding his bicycle behind.

tables.Name: Ernst  Wolf
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man sitting on a motorcycle|Wolf on his pacemaker motorcycle in 1906
tables.Location of death and additional informa: While standing at the edge of the Dresden Track, Wolf was run over by a fellow pacemaker. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt . Ein radsportliches Jahrbuch. VI. Jahrgang. Berlin 1908, p. 57-60.

tables.Name: Karel  Verbist
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man in a bicycle racing uniform standing comfortably|Karel Verbist with his arms crossed while standing.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Verbist collided with his pacemaker's (Constant Ceurremans') motorcycle on the Bruxelles track. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 8, 1909, p. 49. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt. Verbist is the subject of a macabre Flemish folk-poem... "Chareltje, Chareltje Verbist, hadt ge niet gereden op de pist(e), hadt ge niet gelegen in de kist." which roughly translates to "Verbist, if you hadn't ridden your bike, you may not have ended up in a coffin."

tables.Name: Fritz  Theile
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist on a bicycle|Fritz Theile in 1911
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Zehlendorf Velodrome Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 10, 1911, p. 46. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Hans  Bachmann
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Velodrome Hall Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 12, 1913, p. 7. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Hans  Lange
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Velodrome Hall

tables.Name: August  Kraft
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Strasbourg, France

tables.Name: Richard  Scheuermann
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist on a bicycle looking up at the camera|Scheuermann posed on bicycle sometime between 1905 and 1906.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed almost instantly during a 100-kilometer event on the Cologne track. Gus Lawson, Paul Guignard's pacemaker, lost control of his pacemaking motorcycle when the back tire blew out. Emil Meinhold, Scheuermann's pacemaker, then collided – at 50   mph on his motorcycle – straight into the wreckage. Scheuermann and Lawson were both killed almost instantly.  Meinhold was mistakenly reported in the newspapers of the day to have died (which error has been repeated in modern references ) but he recovered from his injuries and was involved in the cycling world for many years afterwards. Sport-Album der Rad-Welt 1919 , Vol. 18, 1920, page 56, Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Gus  Lawson
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man wearing a long coat standing near a racetrack|Gus Lawson c. 1900–1905
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed immediately in a multi bicycle–motorcycle crash on the Cologne track during a 100-kilometer event. (See Richard Scheuermann ' Notes' above)

tables.Name: Max  Hansen
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Berlin Velodrome Stadium

tables.Name: Piet van Nek Sr. Piet van Nek Sr.'s name is also rendered in some sources as "Piet van Neck".
tables.Image: 100px|alt=aA male cyclist posed riding on his bike and looking sideways at the camera.| Piet van Nek on a racing bicycle.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Injured and died as a result of a tire blow-out on the Leipzig track during the inaugural Grote Oostprijs, a 100+   km race. van Nek's Amsterdam artistic gravesite marker is a well-known monument in Amsterdam.

tables.Name: Willy  Hamann
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Treptow track. The crash occurred on July 15, Hamann died six days later in hospital. Rad-Welt , July 23, 1914. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt

tables.Name: Max  Bauer
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Treptow track Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 15, 1917, p. 63. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Jacob  Esser
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died shortly after a crash at the Düsseldorf Germany track that happened when one of his tires blew out

tables.Name: Louis  Darragon
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man in a cycling uniform standing beside his bicycle on a racetrack|Louis Darragon beside his bike.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash on the track of the Vélodrome d'Hiver Paris.

tables.Name: Peter  Günther
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Studio portrait of a man wearing a cap|Peter Günther seated fifteen years before his death.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Günther died the day after an October 6 crash at a track in Düsseldorf. He was involved in a collision with his pacemaker's motorcycle after the motorcycle's rear tire burst.

tables.Name: Hans  Schneider
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Sport-Album der Rad-Welt . Ein radsportliches Jahrbuch. 19. Jahrgang. Berlin 1922, pp. 66–67

tables.Name: Emanuel  Kudela
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist on a bicycle headed straight toward the camera|Kudela in 1906
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Olympia track, Berlin Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 19, 1921, p. 7. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Christian  Oorlemans Some sources spell the name as "Christiaan Orlemans".
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash during a track race at Amsterdam's " Het Stadion ". Thousands attended Oorlemans' funeral procession.

tables.Name: Walter  Ebert
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Magdeburg track Illustrierter Radrenn-Sport ("Illustrated cycling"), a 1924 edition (unknown month, date), Berlin.

tables.Name: Gustave  Ganay
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Seated man in cycling uniform|Ganay in riding attire in 1922
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Stayer. Died from a fall at the Parc des Princes. The crash was immortalized by Ernest Hemingway in A Moveable Feast with "where we saw that great rider Ganay fall and heard his skull crumple under the crash helmet as you crack an hard-boiled egg against a stone to peel it on a picnic."

tables.Name: Franz  Krupkat
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Leipzig track Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 23–26, 1924–1927, p. 164. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Ernst  Feja
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed while training on the concrete track at Oerlikon in Zurich Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 23–26, 1924–1927, p. 167. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Constant  Ceurremans
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash on the track at Cologne. Also involved in Karel (Charles) Verbist's fatal crash in 1909

tables.Name: Werner  Krüger
tables.Image: 100px|alt=An old postcard showing a pacemaker and a male cyclist|Krüger as pacemaker for Arttur Stellbrink in 1909
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after a fall on the Cologne-Riehl track during a stayer race, while riding as a pacemaker for Emil Thollembeek Was a survivor of the 1909 Friedenau disaster.

tables.Name: Georg  Pawlack Pawlack is also rendered as "Georg Klein Bohrau Pawlack".
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Run over by a pacemaker after his bicycle slipped on a rain-soaked track

tables.Name: Georges  Lemaire
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Three men standing with a bicycle|Georges Lemaire and two relatives
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash during the Belgian club championship road race in Uccle, Belgium.

tables.Name: Emil  Richli
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Track championships Rennfahrer-Schicksale ("Racing fates"), authors: Walter Boßhardt, Henry Eggenberger, publisher: Verlag Kurmann, Zürich 1950, 78

tables.Name: Francisco   Cepeda  Francisco Cepeda (cyclist)
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Tour de France . "Fell down a ravine near Bourg-d'Oisans", died while making the Col du Galibier descent.

tables.Name: Giulio  Bartali
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Brother and training partner of 1938 and 1948 Tour de France winner Gino Bartali . Giulio and Gino Bartali were participating in a regional championship race in Florence, the Targa Chiari, when a car drove onto the course and mowed Giulio down. He died two days later in hospital, never having regained consciousness.

tables.Name: Len  Johnson
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Melbourne to Sale Race. Johnson was riding on the Princes Highway, when he slowed due to a puncture and was hit by a truck laden with timber.

tables.Name: Stefan  Veger
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Track Gent Der Deutsche Radfahrer – ''The German Cyclist'' (magazine) , November 10, 1936

tables.Name: André  Raynaud
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Man in a cycling suit wearing a leather helmet|André Raynaud wearing a helmet.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: A world champion stayer, Raynaud died during an Antwerp Sportpaleis track race. Der Deutsche Radfahrer – ''The German Cyclist'' (magazine) , March 23, 1937

tables.Name: Adrien Buttafochi
tables.Location of death and additional informa: As he was descending the Col Esteret pass during the Grand Prix d'Antibes , Buttafocchi crashed into a wayward vehicle driving up the hill. He lingered in a coma for a few days before dying. Der Deutsche Radfahrer – ''The German Cyclist'' (magazine) , July 6, 1937

tables.Name: Hefty  Stuart
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Riding in a motor pacing event, Walter "Hefty" Stuart's front tire blew out, causing him to fall and he was run over by a following pacing motorcycle. Stuart died in hospital two weeks later.

tables.Name: Jean   Alavoine
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist posed riding a bicycle|Alavoine in the 1910s
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Alavoine's professional career lasted from 1908 until 1925, he won 17 Tour de France stages along the way. In 1943 at the age of 55 he died during a veterans race in Argenteuil .

tables.Name: Richard   Depoorter
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed into a tunnel wall on a descent of the Sustenpas near Bern, during the Tour of Switzerland , died onsite or shortly thereafter of his injuries.

tables.Name: Léon   Level
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Three male cyclists standing in a row|Léon Level (right) and another rider before a race.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Fractured his skull in a crash and died at the Parc des Princes track in Paris.

tables.Name: Paul   Chacque
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died when he fractured his skull during a race at the "Parc des Princes" track in Paris

tables.Name: Paul Kroll
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a crash during a Berlin 1000 laps race at the Funkturm track

tables.Name: Gerard   van Beek
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man being carried by several other men on a racetrack|Van Beek after winning a race in 1948
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died of a skull fracture suffered during the Berlin Six-Day race held in March

tables.Name: {{sortname|Camille|Danguillaume}}
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist in a cycling uniform looking into the uniform|Danguillaume in 1943
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed in collision with press motorcycle during Critérium International (Championship of France)

tables.Name: Serse   Coppi
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed near the end of the 1951 Tour of Piedmont (aka "Tour du Piedmont" and "Giro del Piemonte") on June 28. Finished race but then died the next day.

tables.Name: Rudi   Mirke
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Berlin Six Day . Died after falling during the race.

tables.Name: Orfeo   Ponsin
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed in the fourth stage of the 1952 Giro d'Italia . Died in hospital that evening.

tables.Name: Erich   Metze
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Metze suffered three skull fractures during his long career, which stretched from 1930 until 1952. The last one was fatal and occurred during a race on the Erfurt cycle track.

tables.Name: Stan   Ockers
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist looking over his shoulder|Stan Ockers
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 1955 World Champion (Road Race) track race at the Sportpaleis Antwerp

tables.Name: Joaquín   Polo
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died of heatstroke during the 1958 Tour of Portugal

tables.Name: Raúl   Motos
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died of heatstroke during the 1958 Tour of Portugal

tables.Name: Russell   Mockridge
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Two male cyclists in profile|Russell Mockridge (left) and Hubert Opperman in 1948
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Tour of Gippsland.

tables.Name: Kiyoshi Kitazawa
tables.Location of death and additional informa: All-Star Keirin ja オールスター競輪 , taking place at the Osaka Nagai Velodrome

tables.Name: Knud Enemark   Jensen
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Jensen collapsed during the 100-kilometer team time trial at the 1960 Summer Olympic Games , suffering a skull fracture and dying several hours later. Some commentators state that Jensen's autopsy revealed traces of drugs in his system but the Italian authorities' 1961 report stated that the official cause of death was heatstroke. A race-day temperature of 40 degrees Celsius/104 degrees Fahrenheit and Jensen's post-crash care (being kept in a "hot military tent"), could have been probable contributing factors.

tables.Name: Alessandro   Fantini
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after a crash at the end of the sixth stage of the 1961 Tour of Germany

tables.Name: Shosuke Fukushima ja 福島昭亮
tables.Location of death and additional informa: All-Star Keirin ja オールスター競輪 , taking place at the Kishiwada Velodrome ja 岸和田競輪場 Fell off his bike, where he died of skull fracture.

tables.Name: Tom   Simpson
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Tom Simpson in his 1966 cycling uniform|Tom Simpson
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Fell unconscious from his bike on the ascent up Mont Ventoux during the Tour de France, after suffering heart issues, heatstroke, the aftereffects of taking amphetamine and other medical issues. He died shortly afterwards in hospital, near where his famous memorial stands.

tables.Name: Masamitsu Nakamura
tables.Location of death and additional informa: National Prefectural Keirin Championship ja 全国都道府県選抜競輪 , Shizuoka Velodrome ja 静岡競輪場 His and Fujishima's death at a high-profile race (the equivalent of today's GI) led to wider rule revisions by NJS to improve safety.

tables.Location of death and additional informa: Spanish Championship

tables.Location of death and additional informa: Zingem, Belgium

tables.Image: 100px|alt=Two men in conversation, one of them holding a toddler|Jean-Pierre Monseré holding his child after winning a race.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Grand Prix de Retie.

tables.Location of death and additional informa: Tour of Andalusia

tables.Name: Graeme   Jose

tables.Location of death and additional informa: Trofeo Luis Puig . Died after colliding with a car during race.

tables.Name: Connie   Meijer

tables.Name: Saúl   Morales Some sources render this cyclist's name as Saúl Morales Corral.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by truck during the 2000 Tour of Argentina

tables.Name: {{sortname| Nicole | Reinhart}}
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died as a result of a single-bike crash when she hit a tree during the 2000 BMC Tour event in Arlington/Boston.

tables.Name: Masaharu Hattori ja 服部雅春
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 2R, A-class race; Ito Onsen Velodrome ja 伊東温泉競輪場 . Collapsed during cooling lap after finishing 4th. Was already in cardiac arrest when doctors arrived. Later died in hospital.

tables.Name: Andrey   Kivilev
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed during the 2003 Paris–Nice and died the next morning. Kivilev was not wearing a helmet. After his death, the wearing of helmets became compulsory in all official UCI races.

tables.Name: Juan   Barrero
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed during a stage of the Vuelta a Colombia ("Tour of Colombia") on a high-speed descent early on in the stage. Barrero died in hospital shortly thereafter.

tables.Name: Tim   Pauwels
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Passed out during an early-season cyclo-cross race in Erpe-Mere, Belgium and crashed. Some sources say that Pauwels' heart had stopped before the crash.

tables.Name: Alessio   Galletti
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died of a heart attack 15   km from the finish line of the Subida al Naranco

tables.Name: [[Patricia Pepper]]
tables.Location of death and additional informa: At 70 years of age, while competing in a time trial her bike and another bike collided — she died in hospital nine days later.

tables.Name: Isaac   Gálvez
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Six Days of Ghent . Galvez died after coming into contact with Dimitri De Fauw and then crashing into a track railing.

tables.Name: Bruno   Neves
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Classica de Amarante. Neves' collapse from heart failure caused him to crash during the race.

tables.Name: Kei Uchida ja 内田慶
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 7R of S-class qualifying race during the first day of the All-Star Keirin ja オールスター競輪 at the Ichinomiya Velodrome ja 一宮競輪場 . During the penultimate part of the decisive lap, whilst attempting to pass, Uchida was nudged into one side by an overtaking rider, who then rebounded into another rider who had to rear back. This caused the spokes of Uchida's bicycle to collapse, throwing him over the handlebar face-first, striking his face onto the ground. He died in hospital hours later. By then, Uchida was the 48th cyclist to die in accidents in the history of professional keirin, also the 4th to die in a GI graded event.

tables.Name: Terumitsu Nakagaki ja 中垣輝光
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 3R, A-class qualifying race, Hiroshima Velodrome ja 広島競輪場 . During the closing lap, he began to lose pace and collapsed where he was taken into hospital. He had already been in cardiac arrest and died shortly after.
During the Giro del Friuli Venezia Giulia at Pesariis, Casarotto hit the wing mirror of a SUV parked on the course and then crashed.  He died September 15, 2010, of head injuries and trauma.

tables.Name: Wouter   Weylandt
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man in sunglasses and a cycling uniform |Wouter Weylandt wearing a Quick Step uniform and sunglasses.
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Fatal crash on the Passo del Bocco during the third stage of the 2011 Giro d'Italia

tables.Name: Teruo Sakamoto ja 坂本照雄
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 9R, A-class qualifying race, Odawara Keirin Velodrome ja 小田原競輪場 . Crashed into a timing equipment, used for photo finishes, after swerving inward to avoid another rider, who fell off in front of him whilst fighting for the lead. Died in hospital.

tables.Name: Wouter   Dewilde
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Dewilde was involved in a fatal crash during a regional event for elite racing cyclists without a contract, Brugge (West-Vlaanderen), Belgium

tables.Name: Junior   Heffernan
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after collision with a car during the Severn Bridge Road Race in Gloucestershire

tables.Name: Marcelo   Graces
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Graces was involved in a fatal crash during last stage of Vuelta Ciclista del Uruguay after collision with a motorcycle during the time trial final stage of the race

tables.Name: Jeanné   Nell
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in Cape Town , South Africa, during a keirin race

tables.Name: Annefleur   Kalvenhaar
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in Grenoble , France, due to a crash during a UCI World Cup XCE race in Méribel , France

tables.Name: Will   Olson
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in Crested Butte during an Enduro World Series race

tables.Name: Antoine   Demoitié
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist wearing a colorful uniform|Antoine Demoitié wearing a Wallonie-Bruxelles uniform in 2015
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in hospital in Lille , due to injuries sustained in a crash during the Gent–Wevelgem race.  Having been one of a group of cyclists who fell as the race went through Sainte-Marie-Cappel , he was struck by a motorbike accompanying the race.

tables.Name: Daan   Myngheer
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man wearing a cycling windbreaker smiling into the camera| Daan Myngheer
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in hospital two days after suffering a heart attack during first stage of Critérium International

tables.Name: Gijs   Verdick
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died a week after suffering two heart attacks at the Under-23 Carpathian Couriers Race in Poland.

tables.Name: Bahman   Golbarnezhad
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist in the Uniform of the Iranian Paralympic Team riding a bicycle|Bahman Golbarnezhad riding a bicycle
tables.Location of death and additional informa: 2016 Summer Paralympics . Had a head injury after colliding with a rock midway through the C4 road race of the Paralympics . Subsequently had cardiac arrest and died on the way to hospital.

tables.Name: Eslam Nasser   Zaki
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Suffered a fatal heart attack while riding in the omnium event at the African Continental Track Championships at the Cyril Geoghegan Velodrome in Durban , South Africa . He was a member of the Bahraini VIB Bikes road race team.

tables.Name: Mike   Hall   Mike Hall (cyclist)
tables.Image: 100px|alt= Mike Hall, seated, at a table with a microphone in his hand, before a 2015 race|Mike Hall
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after being struck by a car on the outskirts of Canberra , Australia.  He was in second place in a 3,300-mile race, the Indian Pacific Wheel Race, which was subsequently cancelled.

tables.Name: Chad   Young
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist in Team USA cycling uniform|Chad Young in 2016
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Received severe head injuries in a fall on a descent during the final stage of the Tour of the Gila into Pinos Altos, New Mexico and died in hospital in Tucson five days later.

tables.Name: Casey   Saunders
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after crashing in the Pro-1-2 criterium at Tour of Kansas City

tables.Name: Ray   Dare
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after being rear-ended by a vehicle on the A41 near Aylesbury while attempting a 10 mile national record for his age (91) in a time trial.

tables.Name: Mathieu   Riebel
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died instantly in a collision on the descent of the Col de La Pirogue during Stage 9 of the Tour de Nouvelle-Calédonie

tables.Name: Michael   Goolaerts
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A man in a cycling uniform and suncap|Michael Goolaerts
tables.Location of death and additional informa: During the Paris–Roubaix classic, Goolaerts suffered a cardiorespiratory arrest on the third cobbled sector at Saint-Python , after 109   km of racing. He was resuscitated by paramedics and transferred by helicopter to CHRU-Hospital in Lille , although he died later that day.

tables.Name: Stef   Loos
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after colliding with a van on the Mémorial Alfred Gadenne after a group of three riders took the wrong turning at a junction

tables.Name: Robbert   de Greef
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist in partial uniform casually looking into the camera| Robbert de Greef
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Suffered cardiac arrest during the Omloop van de Braakman race

tables.Name: Bjorg   Lambrecht
tables.Image: 100px|alt=A male cyclist standing in full cycling uniform| Bjorg Lambrecht
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed into a concrete culvert during stage three of the 2019 Tour de Pologne . He was taken to a hospital by ambulance and died during surgery.

tables.Name: Suleiman Kangangi
tables.Image: 100px|alt=closeup of man wearing a racing helmet and smiling broadly|Suleiman Kangangi
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Kangangi was killed in a high speed crash while riding in a gravel race in Vermont .

tables.Name: Gino Mäder
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Gino Mäder died following a crash on the descent of the Albula Pass on stage 5 of the Tour de Suisse .

tables.Name: Archie  McEachern
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Coliseum Cycling Track, Atlantic City, New Jersey. McEachern was participating in a practice run prior to the Atlantic City velodrome's official opening. Riding close to the pace vehicle, McEachern was fatally injured when the bike's drive chain broke and died within minutes.

tables.Name: {{nul}} Breton
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Parc des Princes track. Killed when he steered his bicycle away from another cyclist and into the path of a 14-horsepower motorcycle being driven at 50   mph by Marius Thé. The track management allowed motorcyclists and racing bicyclists (called "flyers") to train at the same time.

tables.Name: Edouard  Taylor Taylor is also known as "Edouard-Henry Taylor".
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died at Aubervilliers, France in 1903.

tables.Name: Hugh  McLean
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Revere, Massachusetts cycling track. Died as a result of a training crash earlier in the month at the cycling track in Revere, Massachusetts.

tables.Name: Franz  Suter
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Franz Suter standing and wearing a striped sweater in 1912|Franz Suter
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck by a train while training with his brother Paul near Courbevoie , France

tables.Name: Ottavio  Bottecchia
tables.Image: 100px|alt=black&white studio photo of a man looking directly into the camera|Ottavio Bottecchia
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Found by the side of the road with bruises and serious skull fracture. The cause has remained a mystery   – various theories have included a solo-crash/serious fall or an assault by unknown Fascists.

tables.Name: Gustave  Lejour
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died while training on the Frankfurt (Germany) track Sport-Album der Rad-Welt , Vol. 27, 1928, p. 11. Berlin, Verlag Rad-Welt.

tables.Name: Leo  Verberkt
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died on the "Aalsterweg" near Eindhoven after being hit by a bus. [https://resolver.kb.nl/resolve?urn=MMRHCE01:000047016:mpeg21:p003 Leo Verbekt overreden en gedood] , De Zuid-Willemsvaart , 08 December 1936, via Delpher

tables.Name: Seiki Hirama ja 平間誠記
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Fell off his bike and fractured his skull on August 16, during training camp at the Hiratsuka Velodrome ja 平塚競輪場 , preparing for the 1968 UCI Track Cycling World Championships . Later died in hospital of cerebral contusion . Hirama wore a leather helmet.

tables.Name: Antonio  Martín
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed by a truck while training near Madrid

tables.Name: Néstor  Mora
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Three members of Team Postobón were killed almost immediately while group training when a truck collided with another vehicle, sending the second vehicle careening into the group of cyclists.

tables.Name: Augusto  Triana
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Three members of Team Postobón were killed almost immediately while group training when a truck collided with another vehicle, sending the second vehicle careening into the group of cyclists.

tables.Name: Hernán  Patiño
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Three members of Team Postobón were killed almost immediately while group training when a truck collided with another vehicle, sending the second vehicle careening into the group of cyclists.

tables.Name: Anders Nilsson
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died immediately when hit by a speeding car during bicycle training, the driver left the scene. National team member in triathlon .

tables.Name: Ricardo Otxoa
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a car during a training session together with his brother Javier (who survived but had serious brain injuries). The Circuito de Getxo was renamed the Memorial Ricardo Otxoa in his honor.

tables.Name: Luke Harrop
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck by a stolen car driven by an unlicensed driver who was out on bail at the time and who also fled the scene. Gold Coast, Brisbane, Australia during a training ride. Having severe head trauma, former champion triathlete Harrop died a day after the crash. In 2003, Australia's Gold Coast Triathlon was renamed in Harrop's memory as the Gold Coast Triathlon   – Luke Harrop Memorial .

tables.Name: David Martin
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a drunk driver during training

tables.Name: Haruko  Fujinaka
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Crashed and died during a practice run for the opening round of the 2003 NORBA National Championship Series at Big Bear Lake, California

tables.Name: Lauri Aus
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a truck driven by a drunk driver while training for the Estonian MTB (Mountain Biking) Championship

tables.Name: Amy  Gillett
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Head-on collision with a car in Germany (while training with her squad for the Thüringen Rundfahrt der Frauen which had been scheduled for the next day)

tables.Name: Frederiek  Nolf
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Frederiek Nolf in a cycling uniform|Frederiek Nolf
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in his sleep of a heart attack during the 2009 Tour of Qatar

tables.Name: Zinaida  Stahurskaya
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck and killed by a speeding car while training for the Belarus national championship on a public road.

tables.Name: Jure  Robič
tables.Image: 100px|alt=male cyclist standing on a winner's podium| Jure Robic
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died in a head-on collision with a car while descending on a narrow mountain forest road in Plavški Rovt near Jesenice, Slovenia .

tables.Name: Carla   Swart
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Turned into the path of an oncoming truck in a bid to retrieve her cycling computer that she had just lost. Swart was a professional who had previously won nineteen individual and team cycling titles spanning four different variations of biking (cyclo-cross, mountain bike, road, and track) while on the Lees–McRae College cycling team.

tables.Name: Carly   Hibberd
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a car while training in Italy

tables.Name: Victor   Cabedo
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Male cyclist during race on his bicycle in colorful orange racing outfit| Victor Cabedo
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died during a training ride after colliding with a vehicle

tables.Name: Iñaki  Lejarreta
tables.Image: 100px|alt=cyclist on bike on a mountain trail | Iñaki Lejarreta
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed in a training crash when his cycle was struck by a car

tables.Name: Burry   Stander
tables.Image: 100px|alt=male cyclist crossing the finish line, arms held aloft – Burry Stander winning the under 23 men's XC title at the 2009 UCI Mountain Bike World Championships | Burry Stander in 2009
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died during a training ride after colliding with a vehicle

tables.Name: Amy  Dombroski
tables.Image: 100px|alt=Amy Dombroski on a bicycle during a race|Amy Dombroski
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a truck while training in Belgium

tables.Name: Kristof  Goddaert
tables.Image: 100px|alt=closeup of a cyclist in bicycle wearing helmet & cycling gear|Kristof Goddaert
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed during a training ride in Antwerp when he fell from his bike and was struck by a bus

tables.Name: Claudio  Clarindo
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck by an automobile whose driver had fallen asleep, Clarindo died almost immediately after being hit.

tables.Name: Kelly  McGarry
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died from cardiac arrest while biking on the Fernhill Loop Track in Central Otago .

tables.Name: Ellen  Watters
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died following a collision involving her bicycle and an automobile during a training ride in Sussex, New Brunswick

tables.Name: Michele   Scarponi
tables.Image: 100px|alt=male bicyclist in colorful racing outfit| Michele Scarponi
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after being hit by a truck, while on a training ride in Filottrano .

tables.Name: Jason   Lowndes
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck by a car while training near Bendigo, Australia

tables.Name: Alistair   Eeckman
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Died after colliding with a line bus on a post-race recovery ride in Weyer, Austria at 2:10   pm local time, the day after racing Powerman Austria, placing 6th. Winner of the 2017 Powerman Duathlon in Panama.

tables.Name: Ben   Sonntag
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Struck by a pickup truck while training near Durango, Colorado . Sonntag was a world-class athlete in multiple sports, including being a professional mountain cyclist. He had previously won elite world championships in winter triathlon, was an All-American in cross-country skiing for the University of Alaska Anchorage , and had won three individual national collegiate cycling titles while at Fort Lewis College in Durango – two collegiate cross-country bike national titles and a championship in short-track.

tables.Name: Jan Riedmann
tables.Location of death and additional informa: A member of Team Auto Eder Bayern, the Under-19 team of Bora–Hansgrohe . Struck by a car while training with teammates near Sugenheim in Bavaria .

tables.Name: Daniel Pedraza Castillo
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Hit by a public transportation bus that had reversed to pick up a passenger on the side of the road while Pedraza Castillo was doing time trial work.

tables.Name: Ryunosuke Narikiyo
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Collision with a truck on public road whilst on a training ride with his teammates.

tables.Name: Gwen Inglis
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Inglis was the 2019 US Masters road race champion in the 45-49 age group and a member of the Back Swift-Cycleton Cycling Team. She was hit by a car driven by an apparently impaired driver that veered into the bike lane while Inglis was on a training ride.

tables.Name: Adrián Babič
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Babič was the champion and the vice-champion of Slovakia in the individual time trial in the under-23 category, Slovakia's junior champion in winter triathlon, and the winner of the Slovak World Cycling Cup of 2019. Competed at the 2018 World Championships . Babič was struck by a vehicle while training

tables.Name: Desiet Kidane
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Kidane was struck and killed while training in Asmara. At the time of her death, the 21- year old cyclist was considered a promising talent in the World Cycling Centre programme

tables.Name: Estela Domínguez
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed in a collision with a lorry at Villares de la Reina at the age of 19, Domínguez, from Valladolid and the daughter of a Giro d'Italia stage winner had been training for her first year as a professional with the Sopela team.

tables.Name: Germán Chaves
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Killed in a collision with a truck while training in Chocontà his hometown at the age of 28. He was training with his father when they were both struck, killing Germán instantly and his father later in hospital. Chaves was an active cyclist since 2014 and was currently with Team  Sistecrédito.

tables.Name: Tijl De Decker
tables.Location of death and additional informa: Collided with the rear of a car while training in Lier , close to his hometown Antwerp . He died at Antwerp University Hospital at the age of 22 as a result of his injuries. De Decker was an active rider for Lotto–Dstny Development Team and was set to join UCI ProTeam Lotto–Dstny for the 2024 UCI World Tour season.

tables.Power: Cancels knock if turned over from the opponent's hand or drawn from the pile
Peek at one of your cards
Peek at one of your opponent's cards
Can swap any card in your opponent's deck for the 9
Take the next two cards from the draw pile and put either one (or the 8 if you choose) into your deck
Swap a row/column with another one in your opponent's set (disorienting them)
Swap any one of your cards of for one of your opponent's
Shield (Kept off to the side face-up, and used to block an opponent's attacks)
Turn one of your opponent's cards face up/Turn one of your cards face down
Can use any combination (without repeats) of two powers from 3 - Black King
Add one card to your opponent's set/remove one card from your set
